publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: George (Gershon) Burnstein (1891-1972) was an unpublished writer who used the pseudonym G. Amber. He lived in Norristown, Pennsylvania, with his wife Mary.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of manuscripts and other documentation of Burnstein's writing and interests. Materials include: numerous unpublished manuscripts of poems, plays, essays, and book-length works on a variety of topics; correspondence with publishers (mainly rejection letters); family and personal correspondence; notes and correspondence related to inventions and Burnstein's interest in scientific topics; many notes, notebooks and letters in Yiddish; and miscellaneous printed materials and newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
